result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane R Fitzgerald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance.  Comply with any and all counseling as recommended by the Agent. Maintain full-time employment. No contact with Napralla Tire. Bond of $950 to be applied to restitution first.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane R Fitzgerald

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM103 & 16CM104 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 16CM103 and Ct. 1 in 16CM104.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  
State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Atty Hendee will file a victim impact statement with the court.  Atty Wilsnack agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 16CM103 and Ct. 1 in 16CM104.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations; gives the court restitution supplement along with victim impact statement.
Court reads the victim impact statement.
Atty Wilsnack makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 16CM103 and Ct. 1 in 16CM104:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
75 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on 16CM103
Report date will be determined by the Agent
Credit = 0 days
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count
AODA and any follow-up treatment
Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Restitution = $580.00 + $58.00 Surcharge = $638.00
Maintain full-time employment
No contact with Napralla Tire
bond to be applied from both cases with restitution being paid first.

Ct. 2 in 16CM104 to be dismissed
to Court from Atty Wilsnack regarding reschedules
Return date on March 2, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on February 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court with attorney Jon R Wilsnack.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM103 & 16CM104 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided.  Atty Wilsnack states that he recently is on the case and requests a new date.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on January 5, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on December 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM103 & 16CM104 tracking together:
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant is eligible for PD but has not been appointed yet.  
BY THE COURT:  Court will recess to give the defendatn time to speak with Atty Gumz.

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Defendant now appears with Atty Gumz.  Atty Gumz asks the matter to be reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset both matters.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will be quashed; cash bond will be reinstated.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant needs time to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Reset one time.
bond continued.
  Return date scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
16CM103 & 16CM104 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to appear at the pre-trial with him as well.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear and the cash bond be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; $750 cash bond to be forfieted.

Statement of Compliance
Signed by CIJ, Victin Witness Coordinator
Criminal Complaint served on Defendant BY MASO/JAIL 09-13-16
$750 Case Bond set combing both 16CM103 and 16CM104 into said bond

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald in court in custody and w/out counsel.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. States the matters before the Court are for Defendant's bond for FTA in 16CM103 and now new charges in 16CM104 related to being picked up on the Warrant for FTA previously in 16CM103 - bond forfeited.  Defendant has received  both Criminal Complaints. Waives right to attorney. Gave current address as 222 Douglas St, Montello, WI  53949. Judge finds probable cause on both cases. Judge advised Defendant of rights to attoroney, SPD, Ct-Appointed or hire own. Judge advised Defendant of charges and potential for outcome if found guilty.  Court enters NG Plea on behalf of Defendant in both cases.  DA asked prior bond remain forfeited and $750 cash bond be entered combining both cases on that bond. Defendant stated his wanting $200 reinstated.  DA objected and Judge determined $200 remain forfeited.
BTC:  $750 bond set regarding/combining both cases. Next Court dates for 16CM103 & 16CM104:  PTC on 09-27-16 @ 10:15 AM and RD on 10-05-10 @ 2:30 PM
Subject in Custody per Sheriff's Dept. MASO

Signed by BNB/9-12-16
- scanned to DA's office
- gave copy to MASO

Defendant Shane R Fitzgerald not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  Atty Hendee asks that the cash bond be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; cash bond will be forfieted.
